value: the concept of scapegoats in black sheep
is one that so many of us coming out of
dysfunctional families grapple with and
that's because in my opinion people in
the other roles golden child lost child
rebel Savior they they're often
comfortable still in their family role
and they haven't begun to seek out what
happened
they haven't been encouraged to look
inward at all but scapegoats
because in black sheep because they were
labeled as different throughout the
entire relationship they automatically
search for answers they're told to by
their family albeit for the wrong
reasons a lot of the time and scapegoats
and black sheep often start to fulfil
the role the family has voiced on them
they're told so often that they're the
cause of all the problems that they
believe it and before reaching any sort
of emotional maturity they will often do
things to prove the family right they
will get involved in all of the
behaviors classically associated with
scapegoats and black sheep you know drug
use running away from home quitting
school having quote bad friends early
pregnancy anger rage criminals petty
criminal activities etc they just seemed
to be magnets for trouble but it's
because they were they were told that
that's what they are and that being said
not all scapegoats and black sheep do go
down that road but some do you've got
the overachievers trying to prove that
they don't they don't deserve the label
that they've been given and then you've
got the ones that give in to it and the
slight distinction I think between
a black sheep and a scapegoat maybe
that's it maybe it's the reaction that
the person has to their label I think
maybe if a scapegoat keeps keeps up
appearances quote-unquote and does all
the right things so to speak they'll be
called the scapegoat and if they go the
rebel route they will be called a black
sheep but really they fulfill the same
role in the family this is such a
pervasive dynamic that there are
multiple articles written by lawyers in
a state law will and probate law about
it there are legal mechanisms in some
areas to deal with the leaving out of a
will of a child who has been no contact
for a long period of time because it is
being recognized today I want to just go
over the function of the scapegoat slash
black sheep within a family or a system
a larger system because in my view in
this culture and possibly all cultures
it seems to me that every system picks a
scapegoat because of its own moral
failing its own cowardice its own lack
of strength and insight that's how I
view it and that's what I want to talk
about today with an example from the
real world
that I think illustrates it beautifully
scapegoat is the garbage can for people
who are not willing to be honest with
themselves and systems that are not
willing to correct problems within the
system there are too cowardly and so
they need to put all of the bad things
in one place
and label it as unacceptable and
eventually get rid of it altogether I
mean there is very deep psychological
thinking that's gone into this by all of
the major names it's a real phenomenon
and I think a lot of us in this recovery
community a lot of people who are
learning that a lot of the problems
they're facing in their relationships or
workplaces etc come from them being
designated as the scapegoat or the black
sheep and we take it personally a lot of
the time the truth is in my opinion it's
not a personal thing it's personal only
to the people who are creating and
maintaining the scapegoat I'm going to
tell a story that at first is probably
going to seem it was very impersonal but
I occurred to me last night
as I was lying in bed someone asked me
to do another talk on the black sheep /
scapegoat and I realized that I have a
what I consider to be a really great
representation of it I was I worked one
time for the correctional services in my
country as supposedly as the Technical
Assistant and what I was supposed to do
what they hired me to do what I tested
for and the reason I took the job was to
to maintain and deliver and upgrade the
technical services of this school I
worked in the school the training area
of the correctional services
and so there were multiple buildings
involved and hundreds of millions of
dollars worth of equipment involved in
the entire school my portion was
supposed to be the technical things you
know computers and projectors and
Printers etc sent speakers speaking
systems and I was to just maintain that
I was the a/v guy basically the a/v guy
that went around and did that stuff
however this was a new position I had
been working in a different area of the
government and I went and applied for
this job tested past did the interviews
past took the job and I signed my letter
of offer and I began to work under
contract in that capacity or so I
thought I was there maybe a week before
they introduced me to the real reason I
was hired it turned out there was very
little to do with the with the technical
stuff it was very well set up and it ran
very well my days would have been very
boring so I was glad at first to see
that there was another aspect to this
job but I didn't know a lot about it I
had no training for it and it was very
highly watched over and what it was was
inventory control purchasing receiving
and disposal of the multi-million Dondre
of millions of dollars worth of building
equipment and goods that came in and out
of this college campus and it turned out
that they had had big problems with it
in the past the whole system was a mess
they had lost track of millions of
dollars worth of goods they were under
investigation for it and there was a
possibility that heads were going to
roll now I was insulated from blame for
any of that because it was before my
time
but thinking back on it last night I I
see now that that whole role was the
scapegoat they actually created a job
and put all of the bad things that they
were facing that they were unwilling to
deal with into a new job and put it on
somebody else somebody completely
unrelated that had nothing to do with it
no knowledge of it whatsoever somebody
from outside of the organization whoever
was going to take that job was going to
end up in the same position that I was
in it was not personal but that's my
point being the scapegoat many times is
not personal not to you not to the
scapegoat it's about the system around
it needing to get rid of culpability or
blame shame mistakes any garbage they
don't want to deal with and it's ironic
to me that that position was a asset
acquisition and disposal because it's a
perfect analogy the college was
perfectly happy to get new things and
bring them in and report to me that oh
we have this new whatever it could be
anything I was every single piece was on
my gigantic list at the inventory let's
say was a new sink for the kitchen they
were happy to get that and give me the
serial number and information to enter
into the database but when it came to
getting rid of things there was hidden
compartments all over the place
chock full of crap that they didn't want
to deal with anymore and there were very
specific rules about dealing with it and
it was extremely cumbersome and the
inventory computerized inventory list
was a
it was a it was a jumble it was a mess
it didn't work properly and I had no
training on but nobody would touch it
nobody wanted to even talk to me about
it it took months for me to even
convince them that I needed proper
training in it and I felt the weight of
that immediately as soon as that aspect
of my job was introduced I was received
differently by the people around me I
ended up with a chip on my shoulder
because it was I went back and read my
letter of offer to see if I somehow
missed this I in the testing and
interview and in the Job Description
nothing about this was mentioned and I
thought maybe maybe I missed it how
could it be this this takes up 80% of my
time how could I have missed this and I
looked and I it was nowhere to be found
in any of the potential paperwork so I
went and said to the boss you know I
have a big problem doing this job I
can't do this job and you didn't hire me
to do this job it's a whole other
category of job according to you know
the structure of this organisation and
she what she did was incredible
she produced after a couple of days a
paper a page she said it was a page that
was missing from my letter of offer for
this job that described these roles and
there it was she actually handed me a
physical piece of paper that said that
and it was my original letter of offer
was six pages long and this was page 7
and all she said was I'm sorry that it
wasn't on there it was a mistake it just
so happens you signed the front page of
these things in this organization so
there was there was the supposed proof
that it was my mistake that it was my
fault and that it wasn't a big deal
anyway can't I just do it and get on
with it I'm not sure if it's clear how
that situation
it represents the role of the scapegoat
but to me it is it it was surprising to
recognize it last night after having
spent years thinking about my role as
scapegoat in my family and then
realizing that that job was they
constructed an entity hired someone to
step into the role they were paying
someone to be the scapegoat in that
workplace and it was literal garbage I
was responsible for the things they no
longer wanted hopefully for those of you
struggling to get your head around why
you were the scapegoat and why it's so
painful and what role it really fills in
your family maybe that illustration can
help you to come to terms with it that
it's actually just a cold reality in our
current culture that there are so many
cowards and so many people who would
rather hurt someone then get their head
out of the sand and deal with their
problems that's the role of the
scapegoat it allows other people to
avoid their problems and eventually
eventually the scapegoat will either be
slaughtered banished or they will quit
they will recognize their role and they
will quit in my family I quit in that
job I quit personally I think that's
better because in my opinion and I don't
have a crystal ball and I or a time
machine as I've lamented many times
bring me a time machine goddamn it I'm
ready for one but I think if I did have
a time machine and I could have gone
back and not quit my
family or my job I think I just would
have become incredibly ill and
eventually in both instances probably
would have been fired
banished slaughtered they would have
trampled me till there was no use
trampling me anymore and if you don't
quit your scapegoat role that could
happen to you I firmly believe that it
doesn't stop until the scapegoat is gone
one way or the other so draw your line
take back your power leave under your
own strength
peace people talk to you soon
